text: Wilshire Grand Center is a skyscraper in the Financial District of Downtown Los Angeles, California. It was built in 2018 and is the tallest building in Los Angeles, the tallest building in California, the tallest building west of the Mississippi River and outside of New York City, Chicago, and Philadelphia, and the 11th tallest building in the United States. The building is 105 floors. It is taller than the U.S. Bank Tower by . The building is part of a mixed-use hotel, retail, observation decks, shopping mall, and office complex, expected to revitalize downtown Los Angeles and the area surrounding the building. The development of the complex is estimated to cost $1.2 billion. ==References== Category:Buildings and structures in Los Angeles Category:Skyscrapers in the United States Category:2018 establishments in the United States Category:2010s establishments in California
title: Wilshire Grand Center
